actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on International Security and Scientific Affairs.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on International Security and Scientific Affairs

official_title: A concurrent resolution to uphold the separation of powers between the executive and legislative branches of Government in the termination of treaties.

summary.text: Provides that, in accordance with the separation of powers under the Constitution, the President should not unilaterally take any action abrogating or affecting the validity of any of the security treaties comprising the post-World War II complex of treaties, including mutual defense treaties, without the advice and consent of the Senate or approval of Congress.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution to uphold the separation of powers between the executive and legislative branches of Government in the termination of treaties.
